title: 105_hr1966
content: The "Special Government Employee Act of 1997" may be cited as the Act. It includes an amendment to the definition of "special government employee." Amendment to Section 202(a) of title 18, United States Code redefines 'special Government employee' for specific sections. It includes officers, employees, commissioners, magistrates, and independent counsels appointed under chapter 40 of title 28. Amendment to Section 202(c) of title 18, United States Code expands the definition of 'officer' and 'employee' to include specific categories such as part-time local representatives of Members of Congress, Reserve officers of the Armed Forces, and officers of the National Guard serving under certain conditions. The amendment to Section 202(c) of title 18, United States Code broadens the definition of 'officer' and 'employee' to encompass various categories, including part-time local representatives of Members of Congress, Reserve officers of the Armed Forces, and National Guard officers under specific circumstances. This allows individuals to perform federal or District of Columbia functions under the supervision of designated officials. The amendment to Section 202(c) of title 18, United States Code expands the definition of 'officer' and 'employee' to include part-time local representatives of Members of Congress, Reserve officers of the Armed Forces, and National Guard officers serving voluntarily for a specified period. Enlisted members of the Armed Forces and individuals appointed without compensation to represent non-Federal interests on advisory committees are excluded from this definition. The curr_chunk states that non-Federal interests must be specifically outlined in the establishment of advisory committees.
